metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14878 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Server: Security: LDAP Auth). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.21 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with access to the physical communication segment attached to the hardware where the MySQL Server executes to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeover of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 8.0 (Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:A/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored.

criterions.comment: mariadb-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mysql-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mysql-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
